subject: Remove WebsocketBadStatusException
commit_message:
Remove WebsocketBadStatusException

Turns out this exception is introduced in version 33 of the
websocket library which is not available on some platforms
(rhel 7.x).

Impact on runtime is that if an exception is thrown while connecting
the websocket, the line "except WebsocketBadStatusException" will
raise a ValueError, crash everything, AND mask the initial exception.
This change makes the exception reporting slightly less specific but
it is still totally useable.

see: https://github.com/websocket-client/websocket-client/blob/master/ChangeLog

Also, add info logging of websocket status while we're at it

The strategy to fix multi-node gate

In the tempest TestContainer, for e.x [1], we get the container with
model.uuid, then assert it with the desire state. The method
_get_container_state will use docker_client to get container. At that
time, the problem happens, docker client can get only container which
run in master node (the node run tempest), so sometimes it may return
None.

The new strategy is passing docker host get from model (model.hostname)
and pass to docker client. By this way, we can get container in the
specific host.

subject: Make @memoize thread-aware
commit_message:
Make @memoize thread-aware

If 2 parallel threads simultaneously make an expensive call to a
memoized function with arguments for which the returned value wasn's
cached before, 2 calls are effectively made in parallel.

It's better to avoid such a situation and if one thread already
initiated an expensive call, block on it in another thread and once
the call in the first thread is completed, unblock and reuse the value
which is cached now.

subject: Update Keystone haproxy config to balance based on source ip
commit_message:
Update Keystone haproxy config to balance based on source ip

Source based routing is necessary for some services where we want the
same clients land to the same servers.

For exanmple, Keystone uses one of many memcached servers - if a client
gets a token from one but then lands on another api server on the next
request, that will bind to another cache and we get failed
authentication.

Other examples are horizon/murano where we upload a package in several
steps. If we don't balance client connections to the same host we will
end up with the package downloaded to one host but unsuccessfully
unpacked/imported on another host.

This option is commonly used in the official OpenStack docs [0]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/controller-ha-haproxy.html

Co-Authored-By: James McCarthy <james.m.mccarthy@oracle.com>

The test case requires access to devices created by DHCP agent. When the
agent is deployed with linuxbridge agent, we start it in a host-
namespace, and then it creates its own qdhcp- namespaces for dhcp ports
inside the host- namespace.

This could be solved by calling:
ip netns exec host-* ip netns exec qdhcp-* ip link show ...
but ip_lib doesn't support constructing such commands.

Of course, we could extend ip_lib to support this use case, but
currently we have larger dragons to fight. We will revisit the skip once
all agents are moved to namespaces as planned by jlibosva@.

This patch merely disables the test case if DHCP agent is running in a

significant changes to ip_lib.

subject: Fix attachments on volume show when volume is attaching
commit_message:
Fix attachments on volume show when volume is attaching

With the new v3 cinder attach flow, nova calls attachment_update
and then attachment_complete. During that time the volume
has 'attaching' status. Because of that status, cinder show volume
will show all the attachments as empty, even if the volume has
attachments. Currently this will only happen during migration,
but when multi-attach is working, this will be a general issue.

The change is to the show volume flow. It will no longer look at the
volume attach status, but only at the individual attachment status's.
Any attachment that has status of attached will be returned by show.

(This will only be an issue in Queens when the new multi-attach flow
is used. There is no need for this change in Pike.)
